articles.title: RBA deputy governor Michele Bullock says outlook for global economy is 'quite worrying' - ABC News
articles.description: RBA deputy governor Michelle Bullock warns of risks in the global economy, but says the RBA's ability to create money helped Australia's economy through the pandemic
articles.content:
The outlook for the global economy is "quite worrying" and it has implications for Australia, a Reserve Bank official has warned.
Key points:

articles.title: 230 Pilot Whales Stranded In Australia, "About Half" Feared Dead - NDTV
articles.description: A pod of 230 pilot whales was found stranded on the rugged west coast of Tasmania Wednesday, with Australian officials saying only half appeared to be alive.
articles.content:
Locals doused the whales with buckets of water to keep them alive. (Representational)

articles.title: Covid: Reserve Bank of Australia takes $30bn hit on bond purchases - BBC
articles.description: The Reserve Bank of Australia's deputy governor says the loss will not affect its normal operations.
articles.content:
Australia's central bank has revealed that it has lost A$44.9bn ($30bn; £26.3bn) on the bonds it bought as part of its efforts to support the country's economy during the pandemic.
